item.title: 波兰放弃煤炭剥离计划，希望为公用事业提供新支持
item.description: 波兰正在取消将无利可图的煤炭资产从国有控股的公用事业公司中分割出去的计划，转而寻求引入新的支持措施，以保持国家电力系统的稳定。【原文：Poland is scrapping plans to carve out unprofitable coal assets from state-controlled utilities and instead seeks to introduce new support measures to keep the country’s electricity system stable.】

item.title: 印度市场平稳度过简街危机和贸易风险
item.description: 印度的恐慌指数已降至近一年来的最低点，这表明对简街交易的监管调查和美国贸易协议延迟的担忧不太可能伤害更广泛的股市情绪。【原文：India’s fear gauge has slid to its lowest in nearly a year, signaling that concerns over a regulatory probe into Jane Street’s trades and delays in a US trade deal are unlikely to hurt broader equity market sentiment.】

item.title: 英国石油公司将向 Catom 出售荷兰燃油零售点和电动汽车充电站
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）周三发表声明称，已同意将荷兰的 300 个燃油零售点和 15 个电动汽车充电中心出售给 Catom BV 公司。【原文：BP Plc has agreed to sell 300 fuel-retail sites and 15 electric-vehicle charging hubs in the Netherlands to Catom BV, according to a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 人工智能大会让初创企业创始人面临质疑
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，马克-伯根（Mark Bergen）想知道的是，这次备受瞩目的人工智能访谈到底是怎么回事。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Mark Bergen wonders about the high-profile AI interview that wasn’t.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚利用共和国银行支付网络向现金宣战
item.description:
Bre-B 是一个集中式、可互操作的支付基础设施，旨在连接哥伦比亚各地的银行、钱包和支付处理商，即时发送和接收资金。【原文：

Bre-B es una infraestructura de pago centralizada e interoperable diseñada para conectar bancos, billeteras y procesadores de pagos en toda Colombia para enviar y recibir dinero al instante.

】

item.title: 哥伦比亚通过新的中央银行支付网络向现金开战
item.description: 波哥大最大的食品市场是哥伦比亚中央银行向现金开战的前沿阵地。【原文：Bogotá’s largest food market is on the front line of the Colombian central bank’s war on cash.】

item.title: 英国船运费率攀升，英国央行再担通胀之忧
item.description: 请为受挤压的英国购物者着想。加税刚刚加剧了通货膨胀，现在又来了第二轮加税，因为美国关税的影响导致运输成本激增。【原文：Spare a thought for the squeezed British shopper. After a tax hike just reheated inflation, now comes round two as shipping costs surge due to the fallout from US tariffs.】

item.title: 澳大利亚储备银行行长因意外减持而备受拷问
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特（Malcolm Scott），驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天，我和斯瓦蒂-潘迪（Swati Pandey）将探讨澳大利亚储备银行的沟通问题。请将反馈意见和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today, Swati Pandey and I look at the Reserve Bank of Australia’s communications problems. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国购房抵押贷款申请跃升至两年新高
item.description: 上周，美国购房抵押贷款申请跃升至 2023 年初以来的最高水平，尽管借贷成本几乎没有变动。【原文：US mortgage applications to purchase a home jumped to the highest level since early 2023 last week, even as borrowing costs barely budged.】

item.title: 韦拉辛哈表示，斯里兰卡有进一步放宽政策的空间
item.description: 斯里兰卡央行行长南达拉尔-韦拉辛哈（Nandalal Weerasinghe）表示，如果通胀率仍低于预期，央行认为还有进一步放宽政策利率的空间。【原文：Sri Lanka’s central bank sees space to ease policy rates further if inflation remains below its forecast, governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.】

item.title: 富达（Fidelity）称，债券投资者对英国的动摇使吉尔伯特债券成为买点
item.description: 据富达国际有限公司（Fidelity International Ltd.）称，债券市场对英国预算政策的影响力远大于美国，因此金边债券更具吸引力。【原文：The bond market holds far greater sway over budget policies in the UK than the US, making gilts more attractive as a result, according to Fidelity International Ltd.】

item.title: 工会称英国住院医生计划于七月下旬罢工
item.description: 英国卫生大臣韦斯-斯泰廷（Wes Streeting）告诉医生们，他不会与他们就薪酬要求进行谈判，因此医生们计划在本月底举行为期五天的罢工。【原文：UK doctors plan to go on strike for five days at the end of the month after Health Secretary Wes Streeting told them he won’t negotiate with them on their pay demands.】

item.title: 沙特外卖应用程序 Jahez 收购卡塔尔 Snoonu 公司主要股份
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯外卖平台 Jahez 已同意收购卡塔尔电子商务平台 Snoonu 的多数股权，这对在中东寻找更多退出机会的风险投资人来说是一个积极的信号。【原文：Saudi Arabian delivery platform Jahez has agreed to acquire a majority stake in Qatari e-commerce platform Snoonu, in a positive signal for venture capital investors looking for more sign of exits in the Middle East.】

item.title: 人工智能竞争白热化，马努斯加速从中国转向新加坡
item.description: Manus 在新加坡招聘了 20 多名员工，同时缩减了在北京和武汉的业务，几个月前，这家由中国人创办的人工智能先驱公司获得了硅谷一位著名投资人的支持。【原文：Manus is hiring more than 20 people for Singapore while shrinking its operations in Beijing and Wuhan, months after the Chinese-founded AI pioneer secured the backing of a prominent Silicon Valley investor.】

item.title: 日产汽车出售可转换债券融资 14 亿美元
item.description: 根据彭博新闻社看到的交易条款，日产汽车公司已通过出售可转换为股票的债券筹集了 2,000 亿日元（14 亿美元）的资金，这家陷入困境的日本汽车制造商正在寻求资金以维持其正常运营。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. has raised ¥200 billion ($1.4 billion) from the sale of bonds convertible into stock, according to terms of the deal seen by Bloomberg News, as the ailing Japanese carmaker seeks funds to keep its operations on track.】

item.description:

item.title: 特朗普关税期限已过，英国钢铁业敦促采取行动
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）要求在最后期限前完成谈判，征收更高的关税，英国钢铁行业呼吁政府就美国关税问题达成最终协议。【原文：The UK’s steel sector called on the government to finalize a deal on US tariffs as negotiations ran up against President Donald Trump’s latest deadline to slap even higher levies.】

item.title: 由 Blackstone 投资的赌场公司 Cirsa 在西班牙首次亮相便稳健开业
item.description: Cirsa Enterprises SA 周三在西班牙首次上市时，股价与发行价持平，为该公司的交易开了个好头。【原文：Cirsa Enterprises SA shares traded in line with its offer price in its debut in Spain on Wednesday, a steady start to trading for the company that’s key to setting the tone for European offerings after the summer quiet period.】

item.title: 沙特地产股因外资持股规则变更而反弹
item.description: 沙特王国批准了一项新的法律，将设立外国人可以拥有房产的指定区域，沙特房地产公司的股票因此大涨。【原文：Shares of Saudi property companies got a strong boost after the kingdom approved a new law that will lead to the creation of designated zones where foreigners are able to own property.】

item.title: 高盛要求初级银行家宣誓抵御私募股权公司挖角
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. plans to ask junior bankers to confirm their loyalty on a regular basis in a bid to limit advances from talent-hungry buyout firms.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的继任者可能难以达到特朗普的降息要求
item.description: 如果有人认为美国中央银行的下一任领导人会如愿以偿地降低借贷成本，那么美联储的密切关注者们要告诉他一个信息：别指望了。【原文：Close Federal Reserve watchers have a message for anyone who thinks the next leader of the US central bank will deliver lower borrowing costs on a silver platter: Don’t count on it.】

item.title: 印度提升稀土目标的计划吸引了韦丹塔和 JSW 的兴趣
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，印度提出的一项促进本地稀土磁铁生产的计划已引起了一些大型企业集团的初步兴趣，因为印度正努力减少在这些重要的电动汽车和风力涡轮机材料方面对中国的依赖。【原文：A proposed plan by India to spur local production of rare-earth magnets has drawn initial interest from a clutch of large conglomerates, people familiar with the matter said, as the country seeks to cut its reliance on China for these vital electric-vehicle and wind-turbine materials.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚启动紧缩计划后提供美元和欧元债务
item.description: 在政府的一揽子财政紧缩计划推动其债务证券反弹之后，罗马尼亚今年第三次利用国际市场。【原文：Romania is tapping international markets for the third time this year after the government’s austerity package fueled a rally in its debt securities.】

item.title: 印尼在谈判代表与特朗普官员会面时兜售 "甜头
item.description: 印尼的首席贸易谈判代表计划在华盛顿与唐纳德-特朗普总统的内阁成员会面，在本周为达成一项决议所做的最后努力被破坏后，他将带着几笔商业交易来推进关税谈判。【原文：Indonesia’s lead trade negotiator plans to meet with members of President Donald Trump’s cabinet in Washington, armed with several business deals to advance tariff talks after a last-hour effort to secure a resolution this week was derailed.】

item.title: 红牛解雇克里斯蒂安-霍纳（Christian Horner），F1 任期画上动荡句号
item.description: 克里斯蒂安-霍纳（Christian Horner）被解除了一级方程式冠军车队红牛车队首席执行官兼总裁的职务。【原文：Christian Horner has been let go as chief executive officer and principal of champion Formula 1 team Red Bull Racing, following struggles both on and off the track over the past year.】

item.title: 不被看好 "的股票反弹正吸引一些大买家离场
item.description: 快钱投资者在坐等美国股市大幅反弹之后，正逐步重返美国股市，这为美国股市进一步向未知领域扩展提供了支持。【原文：Fast-money investors are edging their way back into US stocks after sitting out a furious rally, bolstering the case for equities to extend their advance further into uncharted territory.】

item.title: 英国央行五年来首次审查银行资本规则
item.description: 英国央行将在五年内首次审查其为银行设定的资本要求总体水平，因为官员们认定，在过去十年的大部分时间里，贷款人基本上都能在困难时期保持足够的缓冲。【原文：The Bank of England will review the overall level of capital requirements it sets for banks for the first time in five years after officials determined that lenders have largely been able to keep an adequate cushion against hard times for much of the past decade.】

item.title: 英国央行警告对冲基金利用吉尔债券杠杆的风险日益增加
item.description: 英格兰银行（Bank of England）周三表示，金边债券中的杠杆对冲基金策略所带来的金融稳定风险正在增加，官员们警告说，其交易活动的不透明性加剧了这种威胁。【原文：Financial stability risks from leveraged hedge fund strategies in gilts are growing, the Bank of England said Wednesday, with officials warning the opaque nature of their trading activity exacerbates the threat.】

item.title: 阿布扎比石油巨头因穆尔班供应困局招致交易商愤怒
item.description: 阿布扎比国家石油公司（Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.【原文：Confusion around Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.’s supply of its flagship crude grade for this month has left traders frustrated and questioning official messaging around output.】

item.title: S&P 公司称菲律宾可抵御关税但面临风险
item.description: 根据S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）的数据，菲律宾经济可能会抵御美国更高的征税，但在全球不确定性的情况下，菲律宾经济面临外国投资减少的风险。【原文：The Philippine economy is likely to be resilient to higher US levies but faces the risk of lower foreign investments amid the global uncertainty, according to S&P Global Ratings.】
